com.appglu.android.sync
Class SyncApi

java.lang.Object
  com.appglu.android.sync.SyncApi

public final class SyncApi
extends Object

SyncApi is used to synchronize the data in your local SQLite tables with the AppGlu server.
Before using SyncApi you must first create a SQLite database, extending SyncDatabaseHelper.

There are two ways to provide a SyncDatabaseHelper instance to SyncApi:

1. Setting a default SQLite database helper on initialization:

AppGluSettings settings = new AppGluSettings("appKey", "appSecret");
settings.setDefaultSyncDatabaseHelper(new ExampleSyncDatabaseHelper(this));
SyncApi syncApi = AppGlu.syncApi();

2. Provide a SQLite database helper to AppGlu.syncApi(SyncDatabaseHelper):

SyncApi syncApi = AppGlu.syncApi(new ExampleSyncDatabaseHelper(this));

Since:
1.0.0
See Also:
SyncDatabaseHelper, AppGlu, SyncOperations, AsyncSyncOperations

readBitmapFromFileStorage

public android.graphics.Bitmap readBitmapFromFileStorage(StorageFile storageFile,
                                                         int inSampleSize)
Reads a file that has previously being downloaded by the SyncIntentService.

Parameters:
storageFile - has to contain either an ID or a URL
inSampleSize - how much smaller that the image will be, for example, inSampleSize equals 2 will return an image 1/2 the size of the original
Returns:
A Bitmap object or null, if the file is not found

requestedWidth - the final image width will be close to the requestedWidth
requestedHeight - the final image height will be close to the requestedHeight
Returns:
A Bitmap object or null, if the file is not found

readBitmapToImageViewInBackground

public void readBitmapToImageViewInBackground(StorageFile storageFile,
                                              android.widget.ImageView imageView,
                                              android.widget.ProgressBar progressBar)
Reads a file that has previously being downloaded by the SyncIntentService, convert it to a Bitmap, and then load it into the provided ImageView reference.
If a ProgressBar is provided, then it will be displayed as long as the image is loading.

Parameters:
storageFile - has to contain either an ID or a URL
imageView - a ImageView reference from your Activity
progressBar - a ProgressBar reference from your Activity or null if you don't want to show a progress bar
See Also:
AppGluUtils.decodeSampledBitmapFromFile(File)

readBitmapToImageViewInBackground

public void readBitmapToImageViewInBackground(StorageFile storageFile,
                                              int inSampleSize,
                                              android.widget.ImageView imageView,
                                              android.widget.ProgressBar progressBar)
Reads a file that has previously being downloaded by the SyncIntentService, convert it to a Bitmap, and then load it into the provided ImageView reference.
If a ProgressBar is provided, then it will be displayed as long as the image is loading.

Parameters:
storageFile - has to contain either an ID or a URL
inSampleSize - how much smaller that the image will be, for example, inSampleSize equals 2 will return an image 1/2 the size of the original
imageView - a ImageView reference from your Activity
progressBar - a ProgressBar reference from your Activity or null if you don't want to show a progress bar
See Also:
AppGluUtils.decodeSampledBitmapFromFile(File, int)

readBitmapToImageViewInBackground

public void readBitmapToImageViewInBackground(StorageFile storageFile,
                                              int requestedWidth,
                                              int requestedHeight,
                                              android.widget.ImageView imageView,
                                              android.widget.ProgressBar progressBar)
Reads a file that has previously being downloaded by the SyncIntentService, convert it to a Bitmap, and then load it into the provided ImageView reference.
If a ProgressBar is provided, then it will be displayed as long as the image is loading.

Parameters:
storageFile - has to contain either an ID or a URL
requestedWidth - the final image width will be close to the requestedWidth
requestedHeight - the final image height will be close to the requestedHeight
imageView - a ImageView reference from your Activity
progressBar - a ProgressBar reference from your Activity or null if you don't want to show a progress bar
See Also:
AppGluUtils.decodeSampledBitmapFromFile(File, int, int)

isSyncIntentServiceRunning

public boolean isSyncIntentServiceRunning()
Returns true if the Sync Service is currently running.
The Sync Service is started when startSyncIntentService(SyncIntentServiceRequest) is called.

startSyncIntentService

public void startSyncIntentService(SyncIntentServiceRequest request)
Starts the Sync Service used to synchronize the data in your local SQLite tables with the AppGlu server.
Before calling this method you must make sure that SyncIntentService is declared on your AndroidManifest.xml.

To start the Sync Service using a SyncIntentServiceRequest, see the following example:

SyncIntentServiceRequest request = SyncIntentServiceRequest.syncDatabaseAndFiles();
AppGlu.syncApi().startSyncIntentService(request);

The example above is going to start SyncIntentService and request it to download and apply changes to all of your tables as well as download all files that are new or updated.

Parameters:
request - defines if changes are going to be downloaded only or downloaded and applied. Also, defines if files are going to be synchronized as well
See Also:
SyncIntentServiceRequest
